citation.article-title: Chemolithotrophic growth of Desulfovibrio sulfodismutans sp. nov. by disproportionation of inorganic compounds.

p.s: Description of Desulfovibrio sulfodismutans sp. nov.
Desulfovibrio sulfodismutans (Sul. fo. dis' mu. tans. L.n. sulfur sulfur; L. pref dis apart; L. part. adj. mutans that which changes; M.L. part. adj. sulfodismutans dismutating sulfur compounds)
Motile, curved rods, sometimes sigrnoid or spirilloid, 0.75 x 2.5-3.5 μm.
No spore formation.
Gram-negative.
Chemoorganotroph.
Thiosulfate, sulfite, or dithionite are utilized as energy sources and disproportionated to sulfate and sulfide.
Acetate and bicarbonate are required as carbon sources.
Lactate, ethanol, propanol or butanol serve as substrates for dissimilatory sulfate reduction and are incompletely oxidized.
Not utilized as electron donors are: Formate, acetate, propionate, butyrate, fumarate, succinate, malate, pyruvate, choline, fructose, and benzoate.
Elemental sulfur, nitrate furmarate, and malate are not reduced.
Strictly anaerobic.
Growth requires mineral medium (1 g NaCl and 0.4g MgCl2⋄6H2O per l) and sulfide or dithionite as reducing agents.
Pantothenate and biotin are required as growth factors.
Selective enrichment culture is possible with sulfite (5 mmol/l), acetate (1 mmol/l), and bicarbonate from anoxic freshwater sediments.
pH range: 6.8-8.2, optimum 7.3.
Temperature range: 15 - 45°C, optimum at 35°C.
Cells contain cytochromes and desulfoviridin.
DNA base ratio: 64.1 mol% G + C (CsCl-gradientultracentrifugation, Flossdorf 1983).
Habitats: Anaerobic mud of freshwater, brackish water or marine environments.
Type strain: ThAc01, DSM 3696, deposited in: Deutsche Sammlung yon Mikroorganismen, Göttingen.
